relation: Great for these types of students
Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
Because we aren't in the safest of areas there is a high standard for safety that is met by campus security.
There is Greek. typically only the divine 9.
there are various community service based clubs. There are also numerous music related activities and clubs.

Each year all students are required to learn the alma matter for a special tradition performed at the end of every orientation week. The alma matter is very important to us and is sung at the end of every game and for other special occasions where the campus has to come together as a whole. We also have a great music program, and the world famous Jubilee Singers still sing, train, and perform.
Its a very prestigious and highly thought of school. Fisk is the number one ranked HBCU in the country.
You have to make your own fun. The city shuts down before 11, and most things going on downtown are for age 21 and up.
Could be better, its nothing like what you would get at home so be prepared for that.
There is a strong sense of community.
Be prepared to be away from home. Be expected to learn new things on your own, through experience and in the classrooms.
Very culturally empowering. The camps as a whole is very accepting and open to new people, ideas, and beliefs. There is a very proud sense of heritage and community.
pageTitle: Fisk University Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {87250=We have all of the Divine 9 Sororities and Fraternities as well as Alpha Phi Omega a co-ed service fraternity, and Phi Mu Alpha a music fraternity. As of next year 2014-2015, two more organizations will be chartered on campus - Sigma Alpha Iota a music fraternity strictly for women and Delta Psi Epsilon a Christian Sorority., 137086=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 78398=Fisk University is a school full of life and culture . Attending that school you'll meet a diverse amount of students , even though it is a Historical Black College / University. I am honestly ecstatic about attending in the Fall of this year, 2013 .}

textAfterTable: Categories Comments Great for these types of students Self-motivated Humanitarians Hard-working Talented Creative Innovative Tips for prospective students Make sure that you have great grades because Fisk invests in it's students Fisk is all about giving back to the community, keep that in mind! Never take 18 credit hours per semester (if you plan to be involved in all the random activities at Fisk) Bang for the buck I know for a fact that I am paying for the great education that Fisk is providing. The facilities could be better but everything has it's pros and cons. Am enjoying being here I'll be honest with you, Fisk is what you make it... if you go out your way to say there is nothing going on and it's too small, you will hate it but if you put yourself out there to be apart of the true Fisk...the madness and the mayhem...then you can see the TRUE Fisk experience...and Fisk is ALWAYS changing... Then you have the teachers that are so intrigued with their students and making sure that they are prepared for after graduation! I could go on and on...it's just an all around great place... it's one of America's hidden jewels
